cards.name: Accumulated Knowledge
cards.text: Draw a card, then draw cards equal to the number of cards named Accumulated Knowledge in all graveyards.
cards.flavorText:
"I have seen and heard much here. There are secrets within secrets. Let me show you."
—Takara, to Eladamri

rulings.text: Because Accumulated Knowledge is still on the stack as you perform its instructions, it isn’t in your graveyard and won’t add to the number of cards drawn.

cards.name: Rushing River
cards.text:
Kicker—Sacrifice a land. (You may sacrifice a land in addition to any other costs as you cast this spell.)
Return target nonland permanent to its owner's hand. If this spell was kicked, return another target nonland permanent to its owner's hand.

rulings.text: You can sacrifice a tapped land.
You choose a second target only if you choose to pay the Kicker cost.

cards.name: Phyrexian Arena
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you draw a card and you lose 1 life.
cards.flavorText: An audience of one with the malice of thousands.

cards.name: Phyrexian Scuta
cards.text:
Kicker—Pay 3 life. (You may pay 3 life in addition to any other costs as you cast this spell.)
If Phyrexian Scuta was kicked, it enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it.

cards.name: Fact or Fiction
cards.text: Reveal the top five cards of your library. An opponent separates those cards into two piles. Put one pile into your hand and the other into your graveyard.

rulings.text: You choose which pile to put into your hand.
Each pile may contain from zero to five cards; they don't have to be split “evenly.”

cards.name: Mana Maze
cards.text: Players can't cast spells that share a color with the spell most recently cast this turn.
cards.flavorText:
"Those who know only one path to victory can never hope to triumph."
—The Blind Seer

rulings.text: Does not affect the first spell cast each turn.
If a spell’s color was changed while on the stack, use the color at the time it was when you started announcement, not as it currently is on the stack or as it was at the time it resolved.

cards.name: Flametongue Kavu
cards.text: When Flametongue Kavu enters the battlefield, it deals 4 damage to target creature.

rulings.text: If it enters the battlefield as the only targetable creature, it must target itself.

cards.name: Flametongue Kavu
cards.text: When Flametongue Kavu enters the battlefield, it deals 4 damage to target creature.
cards.flavorText:
"For dim-witted, thick-skulled genetic mutants, they have pretty good aim."
—Sisay

rulings.text: If it enters the battlefield as the only targetable creature, it must target itself.

cards.name: Flametongue Kavu
cards.text: When Flametongue Kavu enters the battlefield, it deals 4 damage to target creature.
cards.flavorText:
"For dim-witted, thick-skulled genetic mutants, they have pretty good aim."
—Sisay

rulings.text: If it enters the battlefield as the only targetable creature, it must target itself.

cards.name: Opt
cards.text:
Scry 1.
Draw a card.
cards.flavorText: "We need alternatives, Hanna," yelled Gerrard. "Now!"

cards.name: Counterspell
cards.text: Counter target spell.

cards.name: Counterspell
cards.text: Counter target spell.

cards.name: Counterspell
cards.text: Counter target spell.
cards.flavorText:
"Your attack has been rendered harmless. It is, however, quite pretty."
—Saprazzan vizier

cards.name: Counterspell
cards.text: Counter target spell.
cards.flavorText:
"Your attack has been rendered harmless. It is, however, quite pretty."
—Saprazzan vizier

cards.name: Darting Merfolk
cards.text: {U}: Return Darting Merfolk to its owner's hand.
cards.flavorText: You might as well try to catch water with a net.

cards.name: Thunderscape Battlemage
cards.text:
Kicker {1}{B} and/or {G} (You may pay an additional {1}{B} and/or {G} as you cast this spell.)
When Thunderscape Battlemage enters the battlefield, if it was kicked with its {1}{B} kicker, target player discards two cards.
When Thunderscape Battlemage enters the battlefield, if it was kicked with its {G} kicker, destroy target enchantment.

cards.name: Teferi's Response
cards.text:
Counter target spell or ability an opponent controls that targets a land you control. If a permanent's ability is countered this way, destroy that permanent.
Draw two cards.

rulings.text: Remember that a spell only targets something if it is an Aura or uses the phrase “target” in its text.
If none of the targeted spell’s targets is a land when Teferi’s Response would resolve, Teferi’s Response doesn’t resolve due to having no legal targets.

cards.name: Teferi's Response
cards.text:
Counter target spell or ability an opponent controls that targets a land you control. If a permanent's ability is countered this way, destroy that permanent.
Draw two cards.

rulings.text: Remember that a spell only targets something if it is an Aura or uses the phrase “target” in its text.
If none of the targeted spell’s targets is a land when Teferi’s Response would resolve, Teferi’s Response doesn’t resolve due to having no legal targets.

cards.name: Hibernation
cards.text: Return all green permanents to their owners' hands.
cards.flavorText: The deep sleep of winter is not always restful.

cards.name: Gush
cards.text:
You may return two Islands you control to their owner's hand rather than pay this spell's mana cost.
Draw two cards.
cards.flavorText: Don't trust your secrets to the sea.

cards.name: Lord of Atlantis
cards.text: Other Merfolk get +1/+1 and have islandwalk. (They can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)
cards.flavorText: A master of tactics, the Lord of Atlantis makes his people bold in battle merely by arriving to lead them.

cards.name: Vodalian Merchant
cards.text: When Vodalian Merchant enters the battlefield, draw a card, then discard a card.
cards.flavorText: Not choosing sides in a war can be dangerous—but lucrative.

cards.name: Misdirection
cards.text:
You may exile a blue card from your hand rather than pay this spell's mana cost.
Change the target of target spell with a single target.

rulings.text: Once the spell resolves, the new target is considered to be targeted by the deflected spell. This will trigger any effects which trigger on being targeted.
This only targets the spell being changed, not the original or new target of the spell it is affecting.
The target of a spell that targets another spell on the stack can be changed to any other spell on the stack, even if the new target will resolve before the spell does.
You can’t make a spell which is on the stack target itself.

You can choose to make a spell on the stack target this spell (if such a target choice would be legal had the spell been cast while this spell was on the stack). The new target for the deflected spell is not chosen until this spell resolves. This spell is still on the stack when new targets are selected for the spell.
If there is no other legal target for the spell, this does not change the target.
This does not check if the current target is legal. It just checks if the spell has a single target.
You choose the spell to target on announcement, but you pick the new target for that spell on resolution.

cards.name: Wash Out
cards.text: Return all permanents of the color of your choice to their owners' hands.
cards.flavorText:
"Rest now. You've neither won nor lost, but this battle is over for you just the same."
—Teferi

cards.name: Merfolk Looter
cards.text: {T}: Draw a card, then discard a card.
cards.flavorText: When you sink a lot of ships, it's easy to find sunken treasure.

rulings.text: You can't do anything in between drawing a card and discarding a card, including casting or cycling the card you drew.

cards.name: Merfolk of the Pearl Trident
cards.flavorText:
"The paladins would be wise not to forget about the Pearl Trident. The merfolk warriors have turned the tide of more than one human war … and I have no doubt they shall do so again."
—Onean scholar

cards.name: Addle
cards.text: Choose a color. Target player reveals their hand and you choose a card of that color from it. That player discards that card.
cards.flavorText:
"I'll wring out your tiny mind like a sponge."
—Urborg witch

cards.name: Opposition
cards.text: Tap an untapped creature you control: Tap target artifact, creature, or land.
cards.flavorText: Exhausting a wizard can be exhausting work.

cards.name: Prodigal Sorcerer
cards.text: {T}: Prodigal Sorcerer deals 1 damage to any target.
cards.flavorText: He wastes his amazing talents on proving how amazing he really is.

cards.name: Thornscape Battlemage
cards.text:
Kicker {R} and/or {W} (You may pay an additional {R} and/or {W} as you cast this spell.)
When Thornscape Battlemage enters the battlefield, if it was kicked with its {R} kicker, it deals 2 damage to any target.
When Thornscape Battlemage enters the battlefield, if it was kicked with its {W} kicker, destroy target artifact.

rulings.text: You choose whether to kick a spell as you cast it, and you pay that much along with the spell’s mana cost at the same time. Kicking a spell is always optional.
You can pay any particular kicker cost only once. You can’t pay it multiple times to get multiples of either triggered ability.
If Thornscape Battlemage is put onto the battlefield as the result of a spell or ability, there’s no opportunity to kick it.
Kicker costs don’t change a spell’s mana cost or mana value.

cards.name: Crypt Angel
cards.text:
Flying, protection from white
When Crypt Angel enters the battlefield, return target blue or red creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavorText: Once an angel, now an abomination.

cards.name: Crypt Angel
cards.text:
Flying, protection from white
When Crypt Angel enters the battlefield, return target blue or red creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavorText: Once an angel, now an abomination.

cards.name: Crosis's Charm
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Return target permanent to its owner's hand.
• Destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.
• Destroy target artifact.

cards.name: Scoria Cat
cards.text: Scoria Cat gets +3/+3 as long as you control no untapped lands.
cards.flavorText: Like a volcano, it too can erupt without warning.

cards.name: Blastoderm
cards.text:
Shroud (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
Fading 3 (This creature enters the battlefield with three fade counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a fade counter from it. If you can't, sacrifice it.)

cards.name: Thwart
cards.text:
You may return three Islands you control to their owner's hand rather than pay this spell's mana cost.
Counter target spell.

cards.name: Saproling Burst
cards.text:
Fading 7 (This enchantment enters the battlefield with seven fade counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a fade counter from it. If you can't, sacrifice it.)
Remove a fade counter from Saproling Burst: Create a green Saproling creature token. It has "This creature's power and toughness are each equal to the number of fade counters on Saproling Burst."
When Saproling Burst leaves the battlefield, destroy all tokens created with Saproling Burst. They can't be regenerated.

rulings.text: Each token knows which Saproling Burst it came from.

cards.name: Waterfront Bouncer
cards.text: {U}, {T}, Discard a card: Return target creature to its owner's hand.
cards.flavorText: Closing time comes earlier to some than to others.

cards.name: Plague Spitter
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, Plague Spitter deals 1 damage to each creature and each player.
When Plague Spitter dies, Plague Spitter deals 1 damage to each creature and each player.

cards.name: Spiritmonger
cards.text:
Whenever Spiritmonger deals damage to a creature, put a +1/+1 counter on Spiritmonger.
{B}: Regenerate Spiritmonger.
{G}: Spiritmonger becomes the color of your choice until end of turn.

cards.name: Terminate
cards.text: Destroy target creature. It can't be regenerated.
cards.flavorText: Like his mother before him, Darigaaz gave his life defending Dominaria from the tyranny of self-styled "gods."

cards.name: Tsabo's Assassin
cards.text: {T}: Destroy target creature if it shares a color with the most common color among all permanents or a color tied for most common. A creature destroyed this way can't be regenerated.

cards.name: Fire // Ice
cards.text: Fire deals 2 damage divided as you choose among one or two targets.

rulings.text: If the target permanent becomes an illegal target for Ice, the spell doesn't resolve. You don't draw a card.
If Fire targets two creatures and one becomes an illegal target, the remaining target is dealt 1 damage, not 2.

You divide the damage as you cast Fire, not as it resolves. Each target must be assigned at least 1 damage. In other words, as you cast Fire, you choose whether to have it deal 2 damage to a single target, or deal 1 damage to each of two targets.
While not on the stack, the characteristics of a split card are the combination of its two halves. For example, Fire // Ice is both red and blue and its mana value is 4.
If you copy a spell that's half of a split card, the copy copies that same half. For example, if you copy Fire, the copy is also Fire, not Ice.
To cast a split card, you choose one half to cast. There's no way to cast both halves of Fire // Ice.

All split cards have two card faces on a single card, and you put a split card onto the stack as only the half you're casting. The characteristics of the half of the card you didn't cast are ignored while the spell is on the stack. For example, if an effect says you can't cast blue spells, you may still cast Fire.

Each split card is a single card. For example, if you discard a split card, you've discarded one card, not two. If an effect counts the number of instant and sorcery cards in your graveyard, Fire // Ice counts once, not twice.
Each split card has two names. If an effect instructs you to choose a card name, you may choose one of those names, but not both.

cards.name: Dark Ritual
cards.text: Add {B}{B}{B}.
cards.flavorText: "Eye of twilight, give us sight. Take our offer, give us might. Make our power tears of night."

cards.name: Tsabo's Decree
cards.text: Choose a creature type. Target player reveals their hand and discards all creature cards of that type. Then destroy all creatures of that type that player controls. They can't be regenerated.

cards.name: Duress
cards.text: Target opponent reveals their hand. You choose a noncreature, nonland card from it. That player discards that card.
cards.flavorText: "Change your mind, or I'll change it for you."

cards.name: Duress
cards.text: Target opponent reveals their hand. You choose a noncreature, nonland card from it. That player discards that card.
cards.flavorText: "Change your mind, or I'll change it for you."

cards.name: Duress
cards.text: Target opponent reveals their hand. You choose a noncreature, nonland card from it. That player discards that card.
cards.flavorText: "Change your mind, or I'll change it for you."

cards.name: Engineered Plague
cards.text:
As Engineered Plague enters the battlefield, choose a creature type.
All creatures of the chosen type get -1/-1.
cards.flavorText: A single germ can kill more soldiers than ten thousand blades.

cards.name: Llanowar Wastes
cards.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{T}: Add {B} or {G}. Llanowar Wastes deals 1 damage to you.

rulings.text: The damage dealt to you is part of the second mana ability. It doesn’t use the stack and can’t be responded to.
Like most lands, each land in this cycle is colorless. The damage dealt to you is dealt by a colorless source.

cards.name: Shivan Reef
cards.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{T}: Add {U} or {R}. Shivan Reef deals 1 damage to you.

rulings.text: The damage dealt to you is part of the second mana ability. It doesn’t use the stack and can’t be responded to.
Like most lands, each land in this cycle is colorless. The damage dealt to you is dealt by a colorless source.

cards.name: Nether Spirit
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if Nether Spirit is the only creature card in your graveyard, you may return Nether Spirit to the battlefield.
cards.flavorText: It roams in both the worlds of the living and the dead but belongs to neither.

rulings.text: If Nether Spirit isn’t the only creature card in your graveyard as your upkeep begins, its ability won’t trigger. You can’t take any actions during your turn before your upkeep begins.
If Nether Spirit isn’t the only creature card in your graveyard as its ability resolves, it remains in your graveyard.
If you have two Nether Spirits in your graveyard, they stop each other from returning.

cards.name: Persecute
cards.text: Choose a color. Target player reveals their hand and discards all cards of that color.
cards.flavorText: "I want every last one of these tree-hugging, earth-loving, pointy-eared weaklings out of here. Now!"

rulings.text: The color is chosen on resolution.

cards.name: Obliterate
cards.text:
This spell can't be countered.
Destroy all artifacts, creatures, and lands. They can't be regenerated.
cards.flavorText: For his family, Barrin made a funeral pyre of Tolaria.

rulings.text: Counterspells can be cast that target it, but when they resolve they simply don’t counter it since it can’t be countered.

cards.name: Skizzik
cards.text:
Kicker {R} (You may pay an additional {R} as you cast this spell.)
Trample, haste
At the beginning of the end step, if Skizzik wasn't kicked, sacrifice it.

rulings.text: Skizzik’s ability checks at each end step whether it was kicked while it was being cast. You don’t have to pay its kicker cost each turn (and can’t do so, even if you really want to kick it again).

cards.name: Vendetta
cards.text: Destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated. You lose life equal to that creature's toughness.
cards.flavorText: Starke knew the voice was Takara's, but the venom was Volrath's.

rulings.text: If the targeted creature is an illegal target by the time Vendetta resolves, the spell doesn’t resolve. You won’t lose life.
The destroyed creature’s last existence on the battlefield is checked to determine its toughness.

If the targeted creature isn’t destroyed due to totem armor’s effect, Vendetta continues to resolve. You lose life equal to the creature’s current toughness (after the Aura with totem armor has been destroyed).

cards.name: Blood Oath
cards.text: Choose a card type. Target opponent reveals their hand. Blood Oath deals 3 damage to that player for each card of the chosen type revealed this way. (Artifact, creature, enchantment, instant, land, planeswalker, sorcery, and tribal are card types.)

cards.name: Boil
cards.text: Destroy all Islands.
cards.flavorText:
"It is a slaughter, the death of a sea. Never speak of it again."
—The Lord of Atlantis

cards.name: Urza's Rage
cards.text:
Kicker {8}{R} (You may pay an additional {8}{R} as you cast this spell.)
This spell can't be countered.
Urza's Rage deals 3 damage to any target. If this spell was kicked, instead it deals 10 damage to that permanent or player and the damage can't be prevented.

rulings.text: A spell or ability that counters spells can still target Urza’s Rage. When that spell or ability resolves, Urza’s Rage won’t be countered, but any additional effects of that spell or ability will still happen.

If the target for Urza’s Rage becomes an illegal target, the spell won’t resolve and will be put into its owner’s graveyard with no effect. This is true even if its damage can’t be prevented and even though it can’t be countered.

cards.name: Urza's Rage
cards.text:
Kicker {8}{R} (You may pay an additional {8}{R} as you cast this spell.)
This spell can't be countered.
Urza's Rage deals 3 damage to any target. If this spell was kicked, instead it deals 10 damage to that permanent or player and the damage can't be prevented.

If the target for Urza’s Rage becomes an illegal target, the spell won’t resolve and will be put into its owner’s graveyard with no effect. This is true even if its damage can’t be prevented and even though it can’t be countered.

If the target for Urza’s Rage becomes an illegal target, the spell won’t resolve and will be put into its owner’s graveyard with no effect. This is true even if its damage can’t be prevented and even though it can’t be countered.

cards.name: Kavu Chameleon
cards.text:
This spell can't be countered.
{G}: Kavu Chameleon becomes the color of your choice until end of turn.
cards.flavorText:
"They weren't part of my plan, but Gaea insisted."
—Urza

rulings.text: The new color replaces all previous colors.
Counterspells can be cast that target it, but when they resolve they simply don’t counter it since it can’t be countered.

cards.name: Kavu Chameleon
cards.text:
This spell can't be countered.
{G}: Kavu Chameleon becomes the color of your choice until end of turn.
cards.flavorText:
"They weren't part of my plan, but Gaea insisted."
—Urza

rulings.text: The new color replaces all previous colors.
Counterspells can be cast that target it, but when they resolve they simply don’t counter it since it can’t be countered.

cards.name: Pyroclasm
cards.text: Pyroclasm deals 2 damage to each creature.
cards.flavorText:
"When the air burns, only death breathes deep."
—Bogardan mage

cards.name: Pyroclasm
cards.text: Pyroclasm deals 2 damage to each creature.
cards.flavorText:
"When the air burns, only death breathes deep."
—Bogardan mage

cards.name: Tangle
cards.text:
Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.
Each attacking creature doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.
cards.flavorText: Gaea battles rampant death with abundant life.

rulings.text: It identifies the creatures that are not going to untap at the time this spell resolves.

cards.name: Birds of Paradise
cards.text:
Flying
{T}: Add one mana of any color.

cards.name: Blazing Specter
cards.text:
Flying, haste
Whenever Blazing Specter deals combat damage to a player, that player discards a card.

cards.name: Fires of Yavimaya
cards.text:
Creatures you control have haste.
Sacrifice Fires of Yavimaya: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Llanowar Elves
cards.text: {T}: Add {G}.
cards.flavorText: Llanowar covers a million square miles, yet nobody enters the forest without the elves knowing it.

cards.name: Lobotomy
cards.text: Target player reveals their hand, then you choose a card other than a basic land card from it. Search that player's graveyard, hand, and library for all cards with the same name as the chosen card and exile them. Then that player shuffles.

rulings.text: If the player has no cards in their hand, you still get to look through their deck, but you do not get to exile any cards.
You only get to pick one card from the player’s hand.
It exiles the chosen card plus all others in the hand, library, and graveyard. Some people thought the chosen card was not exiled due to some vague wording.
Does not affect cards on the battlefield.
The copies must be found if they are in publicly viewable zones. Finding copies while searching private zones is optional.

cards.name: Undermine
cards.text: Counter target spell. Its controller loses 3 life.
cards.flavorText: "Which would you like first, the insult or the injury?"

cards.name: Spite // Malice
cards.text: Counter target noncreature spell.

cards.name: Spite // Malice
cards.text: Destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.

cards.name: Meekstone
cards.text: Creatures with power 3 or greater don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.
cards.flavorText: The bigger they are, the stronger its pull.

cards.name: Tsabo's Web
cards.text:
When Tsabo's Web enters the battlefield, draw a card.
Each land with an activated ability that isn't a mana ability doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.

rulings.text: A mana ability is an ability that (1) isn’t a loyalty ability, (2) doesn’t target, and (3) could put mana into a player’s mana pool when it resolves.
Activated abilities contain a colon. They’re generally written “[Cost]: [Effect].” Some keywords are activated abilities and will have colons in their reminder text.

cards.name: Static Orb
cards.text: As long as Static Orb is untapped, players can't untap more than two permanents during their untap steps.
cards.flavorText: The warriors fought against the paralyzing waves until even their thoughts froze in place.

rulings.text: If there are two of these on the battlefield, they do not add together. The result is that only two permanents can be untapped.

cards.name: Rishadan Port
cards.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{1}, {T}: Tap target land.
cards.flavorText: Rishada is the gateway to free trade—but the key will cost you.

rulings.text: Once you announce that you’re casting a spell or activating an ability, no player may take other actions until the spell or ability has been paid for. Notably, players can’t try to tap your lands to stop you from paying.

cards.name: Salt Marsh
cards.text:
Salt Marsh enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {U} or {B}.
cards.flavorText:
Only death breeds in stagnant water.
—Urborg saying

cards.name: City of Brass
cards.text:
Whenever City of Brass becomes tapped, it deals 1 damage to you.
{T}: Add one mana of any color.

rulings.text: The first ability triggers no matter how the land becomes tapped.

If you tap City of Brass while you are casting a spell or activating an ability, its ability will trigger and wait. When you finish casting that spell or activating that ability, City of Brass’s triggered ability is put on the stack on top of it. City of Brass’s ability will resolve first.

On the other hand, you can tap City of Brass, put its triggered ability on the stack, and then respond to that ability by casting an instant or activating an ability using that mana. In that case, the instant spell or activated ability will resolve first.

cards.flavorText: Deep in the heart of Urborg lie massive volcanoes whose thick black smoke covers the land with perpetual darkness.

tokens.name: Alex Borteh Bio
tokens.text: Eighteen-year-old Alex Borteh came on strong in the last half of the 2000—2001 Pro Tour™ season. He posted an impressive Top 8 finish at U.S. Nationals and followed that up by coming within one match of winning this year's Worlds. The soon-to-be Ohio State University freshman played a monoblue combo deck that he liked to call "Da Folk." This deck wins by using Opposition and Static Orb to establish a lock down while legions of Merfolk overrun opponents' immobilized defenses.

tokens.name: Jan Tomcani Bio
tokens.text: Jan Tomcani, from Bratislava in the Slovak Republic, came out of nowhere to stun everyone by posting a perfect 6—0 record in the Standard portion of this year's Worlds. Tomcani then proved that his run was no fluke by working his way up to the quarterfinals, where he lost to Alex Borteh in a close five-game match. Tomcani played a version of "Fires," the green-red deck that defined much of this year's metagame. Tomcani's version, which splashed black, follows the normal Fires archetype of playing cheap creatures followed by Fires of Yavimaya and big creatures like Blastoderm or Spiritmonger.

tokens.name: Tom van de Logt Bio (2001)
tokens.text: Tom van de Logt is the 2001 Netherlands National Champion as well as one of an elite group of players who have posted back-to-back World Championship Top 8 performances. Currently a student in Groesbeek, van de Logt posted an impressive 5—1 record in the Standard portion of this year's Worlds. He described his aggressive black-red "Machine Head" deck as "the deck that beats the deck that beats 'Fires.'" He liked the explosive "I win" draws that his deck provided, and he especially liked the way it performed against blue decks.

tokens.name: Antoine Ruel Bio
tokens.text: A member of the famous Team Block Ops, Antoine Ruel, a native of Aubervilliers, France, took his blue-black-red control deck to a third-place finish at this year's World Championships. Ruel credits his teammate Laurent Pagorek for the deck that he calls "AK-Go." The deck, which Ruel played to a 5—1 record during the Standard portion of the tournament, relies on card drawing (most notably Accumulated Knowledge, or "AK" for short), countermagic ("Go," for short), red for board control, and Nether Spirits for the win.
